page.title: 05CHARLBURY'S GLOVE INDUSTRY
page.content: In 1968 the Gloving Industry ended in Charlbury.For 140 years it had been one of the main sources of employment. Gloveresses used to hand sew gloves in villages on the edge of the Wychwood Forest.In Charlbury some men were also involved.Deer and sheep from the nearby Cotswolds meant a lot of available skins.One person acted as a "Glove Carrier" taking and collecting the finished gloves. In 1830 there were 5 families in Charlbury running Glove Businesses.The largest Business employed about 1,000 people and the premises were in Market Street.One of the premises used to be where the Youth Hostel is now and the houses up Hundley Way are where the workers used to live.There was another premises in the Old Post House which is now a Hairdressers.Many of the original Businesses had to close due to the War.
